intro: Epilobium × eliasii, commonly known as the hybrid willowherb, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and disturbed sites. Epilobium × eliasii is notable for its ability to hybridize with other Epilobium species, contributing to its genetic diversity.
